intro: Arnica tomentella, commonly known as the woolly arnica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, thriving in harsh, high-altitude environments. Arnica tomentella is part of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies. Its compact growth habit and unique appearance make it a distinctive species within its ecological niche.
